intro: Blaeria microdonta, commonly known as the small-flowered blae, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant is often found growing in clusters along the edges of water bodies. Its aromatic foliage and delicate blooms make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticulture.
